document_title: Discoid lupus erythematosus: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis, treatment
subsection_name: lupus-ban-do-dang-dia.json_7_Who is susceptible to discoid lupus erythematosus?
subsection_content:
Discoid lupus erythematosus can affect men and women of all ages and is rare in children. The disease is especially common in women, with a rate 5 times higher than in men and often begins in middle age. The estimated prevalence is approximately 20–40 people per 100,000.
Besides, factors that can make the disease more serious include stress, infection and trauma.
Use sunscreen with SPF70 or higher to prevent disease.
To prevent the onset or worsening of discoid lupus erythematosus, you are advised to:
Avoid excessive exposure to direct sunlight.; Always use sunscreen with SPF70 or higher 30 minutes before sun exposure to allow it to absorb. Reapply every 2 hours or when wet.; Wear a hat and clothing that protects your skin, even on cloudy days or in cool areas.; Do not smoke because the toxins in cigarettes can worsen your condition. If you already smoke, limit and quit smoking gradually.
